content.title: UNICEF Innovation Fund
content.description: Rahat completed UNICEF Innovation Fund's program, receiving $100,000 equity-free investment and year-long mentorship. Proud to contribute to global efforts using blockchain and open-source solutions for vulnerable communities.

content.title: GSMA
content.description: Rahat is one of the grantees of the GSMA Innovation Fund for Anticipatory Humanitarian Action, is collaborating with the UK Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office and esteemed partner IFRC/Danish Red Cross to enhance its platform with a blockchain-powered Anticipatory Action (AA) module.

content.title: MIT Solver 2023
content.description: Rahat was among the 31 winners of the MIT Solve 2023 Global Challenges and one of 6 solvers in the financial inclusion cohort. We stood out among 1,500 tech solutions and are now part of the 2023 Solver Class.

content.title: Google Startups for Sustainable Development
content.description: We've completed the Google Startups for Sustainable Development 2023 Impact Measurement Program! We can measure our impact on the SDGs, track our progress over time, identify areas for improvement, and effectively communicate our impact to stakeholders.

content.title: Multi-year Unrestricted Funding from the GSR Foundation.
content.description: Our partnership with the GSR Foundation has reached a new milestone: they have awarded us a multi-year, unrestricted grant to supercharge Rahat Beema, our blockchain-powered micro-insurance platform. This flexible funding means we can adapt quickly, whether that’s accelerating technology development, ramping up community outreach, or responding immediately when extreme weather strikes.

content.title: UNICEF Venture Fund's growth cohort
content.description: Rahat joins UNICEF Venture Fund’s growth cohort.

content.title: DPG
content.description: Rahat was re-certified as a Digital Public Good by the Digital Public Goods Alliance
